“Code Manipulation: Architecture In-between Universal and Specific Urban Space,” UCLA Dissertation Year Fellowship, Principal Investigator. (US$ 32,550) (2011-2012).
“The Nordic Line Study Tour,” QCLF Grant, Principal Investigator. (HK$ 42,000) (2013-2014).
“FlexCode: Shifting the Standards from Prescriptive to Performative,” Start-up Grant, Principal Investigator. (HK$ 200,000) (2013-2016).
“The Architectural Experiment as a Teaching Component in Professional Curricula,” Teaching Start-up Grant, Principal Investigator. (HK$ 91,560) (2013-2015).

“Evaluating the Intersection of Architectural Form and Zoning Code in Mong Kok OZP S/K3/30 and its Impact of the Performance of Public Open Space,” SRG, Principal Investigator. (HK$ 100,000) (2014-2016).

Risultati ottenuti nel trasferimento tec.content: Smog Studio HB, a research oriented design practice committed to mediate the intersections and overlaps between architecture and urbanism. Drawing from the instant interaction between these two disciplines, the firm responds to the fluctuating and advancing social, cultural, geopolitical, and technological conditions of contemporary life. With the objective of investigating and expressing the complexity implicit in modern society, Smog Studio HB masters a wide range of scales (from interior architecture to master planning) and representation techniques (computation, animation, and new media).
